decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing various control spells and creatures to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging protection spells like Ephemerate and Reprieve, along with powerful removal and counterspells like Solitude and Spell Snare, the deck aims to maintain control of the battlefield while slowly building up advantage through card advantage and tempo plays. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Kaldra Compleat and Teferi, Time Raveler allows the deck to close out the game once it has established control. Additionally, the deck includes a toolbox of efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Thraben Inspector to provide versatility and consistency in dealing with threats.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be tutored with cards like Chord of Calling and Green Sun's Zenith. It utilizes combo pieces like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Grist, the Hunger Tide to generate value and control the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Endurance and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt opponent's strategies. The main goal is to use a combination of creatures, spells, and abilities to outvalue the opponent and win through a combination of creature beats and combo finishes.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo, which involves sacrificing Allosaurus Rider to Neoform or Eldritch Evolution to search for Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant for a quick win. The deck also utilizes Planar Genesis and Ureni, the Song Unending for additional synergy and consistency. With access to powerful tutors like Eladamri's Call and Summoner's Pact, as well as protection with Pact of Negation, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker while using control elements like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's strategy. By using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana production, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Devourer of Destiny and Writhing Chrysalis also provide additional utility and disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to mount a successful defense.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana and use cards like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to quickly put powerful lands into play, allowing for explosive plays and combos. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor and other lands that provide additional benefits, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm opponents with huge creatures and game-ending combos. The deck focuses on efficiency and speed to overpower opponents before they have a chance to set up their own game plan.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while applying early pressure with efficient creatures like Nethergoyf and Emperor of Bones. The deck also utilizes Kozilek's Command and Fatal Push for removal and disruption, with the ability to search for key artifacts with Urza's Saga. The inclusion of Thought-Knot Seer provides additional disruption and a solid body on the battlefield. Overall, the deck aims to control the game early on and close it out before the opponent can stabilize.
